title: Source: Texans extend Hunter with $35.6M deal
content: DE Danielle Hunter and the Texans have agreed to a one-year, $35.6 million contract extension, a source told ESPN, confirming an NFL Network report.

title: Xavier applauds fans for big lift in rally vs. UT
content: Xavier erased a 13-point deficit in its biggest comeback win this season to beat Texas and advance to play Illinois on Friday night in a Midwest Region game at Milwaukee.

title: Spurs' Mamukelashvili makes history in 19 minutes
content: With good friend Flavor Flav hyping a crowd that gleefully flooded Frost Bank Center with MVP chants, Spurs forward Sandro Mamukelashvili scored a career-high 34 points, the most in NBA history when playing fewer than 20 minutes.

title: Coaches laud debut of women's tourney payouts
content: For the first time in 2025, women's teams at the NCAA tournament are getting an individual share of the profits, a perk men's teams have enjoyed for years.

title: Lions propose significant playoff seeding change
content: The Lions have proposed a significant change to NFL playoff seeding that would largely use regular-season records as the guiding principle.

title: WR Moore catches on with Vikes after missing '24
content: Wide receiver/returner Rondale Moore, who missed the entire 2024 season with the Falcons because of a knee injury, has reached a deal with the Vikings.

title: Reports: Stanford coach bullied athletics staff
content: Troy Taylor remains on the job. In a statement released by Stanford, he said he had received counseling on "how I interact with others."

title: Games eye L.A. 'rebirth,' Kendrick Lamar role
content: After deadly fires devastated much of Los Angeles, organizers of the 2028 Games told the IOC how the city will rebuild with their help.

title: On Dodgers' Japan trip, Shohei Ohtani is everywhere and nowhere
content: The star is omnipresent in ads across his home country, but fan fervor keeps the real Ohtani out of sight.

title: Free agency in review: Additions, subtractions and the current state of all 32 teams
content: Following the first week of free agency, we're taking inventory on every NFL team and whom they've signed.

title: López, Dumornay, Shaw lead best U21 women's soccer players
content: Welcome to the next generation of women's stars aged 21 or under, with representatives from the NWSL, WSL and across Europe.

title: Mbappé accepts past mistakes as France captain
content: Kylian Mbappé returns to lead France against Croatia after a six-month absence and on Wednesday criticized himself over how he handled the captaincy before.

title: Source: Amorim to make call on Sancho future
content: Manchester United will let Ruben Amorim decide Jadon Sancho's future in the unlikely event that the England forward returns to Old Trafford, a source has told ESPN.

title: McKennie: U.S. needs 'nastiness' in CNL defense
content: United States midfielder Weston McKennie said it's "about time" that the U.S. brings some "nastiness" to its game ahead of Thursday's Concacaf Nations League semifinal against Panama.

title: Chelsea ink Sporting pair, deals worth up to €74M
content: Chelsea have reached an agreement to sign Sporting Lisbon's Geovany Quenda and Dario Essugo in a joint deal worth up to €74.4 million ($81.15 million), the Portuguese side confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Ex-Utd defender Jones 'embarrassed' by injuries
content: Former Manchester United defender Phil Jones has said he was "embarrassed" by the injuries that blighted his Old Trafford career.

title: Martinez joins Messi, out for World Cup qualifiers
content: Argentina striker Lautaro Martinez will miss their upcoming World Cup qualifiers against Uruguay and Brazil due to a hamstring injury, the Argentine FA said on Wednesday.

title: Gravenberch leaves Dutch squad with injury
content: Liverpool midfielder Ryan Gravenberch has been forced to withdraw from the Netherlands squad for their two-legged UEFA Nations League quarterfinal with Spain.

title: Dorvial sees 'progress' despite Brazil's struggles
content: Brazil coach Dorival Jr said his team is making progress despite sitting fifth in the standings ahead of crucial World Cup qualifiers against Colombia and Argentina.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams stand with less than a month left
content: As we enter the final stretch of the 2024-25 NBA regular season, let's see where all 30 teams stack up in this week's power rankings.

title: 'It's Pop's decision. He's earned that': Inside Gregg Popovich's fight to return to the sideline
content: For the first time in 30 years, the legendary coach has been on a different sideline, battling to return to what he once was. This is the story of his season -- and what might come next for the proud franchise he leads.

title: Wetzel: Why the sky has not fallen in NCAA hoops
content: Amid changes and dire predictions about college hoops, top coaches in the game seem to have figured it out.

title: Astros pay homage to city's space history with second City Connect threads
content: Featuring "Stros" on the front of the jersey marks the organization's first official use of the fan-driven moniker.

title: Australia overreactions: McLaren unbeatable, Hamilton's Ferrari regret
content: With the first race of the 2025 F1 season now in the history books, ESPN overreacts to the biggest storylines that came to the fore in Melbourne.

title: McIlroy set up for Masters? Bhatia ready for leap? What we learned at the Players Championship
content: Rory McIlroy is off to a great start with the Masters looming, while Scottie Scheffler is catching up. Here's what we saw at the Players and what it means.

title: Scottie Scheffler stays true to roots with Masters menu
content: From cowboy ribeye to chili, the Texas native and two-time Augusta winner left his mark for the champions dinner.

title: Men's March Madness storylines: Cooper Flagg's impact and SEC dominance
content: How has the industry reacted to the bracket? There's plenty at stake in one of the year's biggest betting events.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United ready to spend big on Simons?
content: Man United are interested in a creative attacker, and RB Leipzig's Xavi Simons fits the bill. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: "Have To Follow Law": Sources On X's Lawsuit Against Centre
content: The government will follow due process and social media platforms must follow the law, sources have said after Elon Musk-owned social media giant X sued the Centre, accusing it of misusing Information Technology laws

title: "No Sympathy For Sunita Williams Because...": Neil deGrasse Tyson Exclusive
content: Plastic cups and time to readjust to Earth's gravity - that is what Sunita Williams, whose eight-day mission to the International Space Station extended to a nine-month stay, will need to recover, astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson told NDTV.

title: Bombs, Atoms, Gandhi: NDTV Exclusive With Head Of Global Nuclear Watchdog
content: Standing in front of a portrait of Mahatma Gandhi, the chief of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), Rafael Mariano Grossi, praised India's nuclear programme as safe and well-managed.

title: 'What Your PM Told Me...': Neil deGrasse Tyson On India's Space Dreams
content: India's space programme is limited only by the ambition of its people, astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson told NDTV in an interview that began with American astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore's return from a nine-month stay in space.

title: Grabbing Breasts, Snapping Pyjama String Not Attempt To Rape: High Court
content: In a case involving an attack on a minor in Uttar Pradesh, the Allahabad High Court has ruled that actions like grabbing breasts or snapping a pyjama string do not constitute rape or attempt to rape but can be considered aggravated sexual assault.

title: "Papa Drum Mein Hain," Murdered Meerut Man's Daughter, 6, Told Neighbours
content: The six-year-old daughter of Saurabh Rajput, allegedly murdered by his wife Muskaan Rastogi and her lover Sahil Shukla, kept telling neighbours, "Papa drum mein hai", Saurabh's mother Renu Devi has said

title: Shiv Sena Reacts To Disha Salian Father's Charge Against Aaditya Thackeray
content: Five years after her death, Disha Salian's father has urged that the case be moved to the CBI and demanded an FIR against Aaditya Thackeray.

title: Jaipur Woman, Lover Kill Husband. CCTV Shows Them Carrying Body On Bike
content: A couple on a bike, the woman riding pillion with a large bundle in her arms - a seemingly innocuous security video from Rajasthan's Jaipur has gone viral after the white bundle turned out to be a body.

title: "Regret Moving Out Of Noida": Corporate Employee Lists Issues With Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru, the Silicon Valley of India, continues to attract IT professionals from across the country. But not everyone finds the city a perfect fit.

title: Chahal-Dhanashree Divorce Granted By Court: "No Longer Husband And Wife"
content: Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma had filed a divorce plea in a family court on February 5 this year.

title: French Scientist Denied Entry To US Over Phone Texts Critical Of Trump
content: The incident unfolded on March 9, when the French space researcher was barred from entering the United States upon arrival in Texas/

title: Meet The Antarctica Research Crew Trapped With "Violent" Colleague
content: A team of South African scientists expected to work together for months in a remote Antarctic research station was left shaken after one of them beat, threatened and sexually harassed at least two of his colleagues.

title: Opinion: Severance: Are You An 'Innie' Or An 'Outie'?
content: Perhaps the AppleTV show's popularity is a sign of our times. Maybe all of us are so sick and tired of our jobs that a science-fiction show about a larger-than-life corporation psychologically abusing its employees hits too close to home.

title: Revanth Reddy vs Tollywood Again? FIR Against 25 Actors For Betting App Ads
content: Renowned actors Rana Daggubati, Prakash Raj, Vijay Devarakonda and Manchu Lakshmi are among 25 celebrities who face a police case in Telangana for allegedly promoting illegal betting apps. The FIR has been filed after a businessman Phanindra Sarma

title: BCCI's Cash Reward For Champions Trophy Is 3 Times Of Official Prize Money
content: TheBoard of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) announced a massive Rs 58 crore cash reward for the Indian cricket team that won the Champions Trophy 2025 title.

title: Young Chinese Women Find Virtual Love In 'Deepspace'
content: Launched last year, the game blends monster-hunting action with sometimes-raunchy cutscenes in a futuristic world where "love knows no bounds"

title: Elon Musk's X sues Centre for using IT Act to 'block' content
content: Elon Musk's X filed a lawsuit against the Indian government for allegedly misusing the IT Act to block content on the platform. The case challenges the interpretation of Section 79(3)(b), claiming it leads to arbitrary censorship and violates Supreme Court rulings. X seeks clearer guidelines and a proper judicial process for content blocking.

title: Meerut murder: Lawyers beat up Muskan, her lover
content: A woman and her lover were remanded to judicial custody after being accused of murdering her Merchant Navy officer husband, dismembering his body, and concealing it in cement. The couple confessed and were assaulted by lawyers during a court hearing in Meerut.

title: Ozempic-like weight loss drug Mounjaro launched in India - Details
content: Eli Lilly has launched Mounjaro in India, a new once-weekly injectable drug for type 2 diabetes and weight management. Approved by CDSCO, it targets GIP and GLP-1 receptors, aiming to improve blood sugar control and aid in weight loss. Clinical trials showed significant results, underlining its potential in treating diabetes and obesity.

title: Daggubati, Devarakonda, other actors booked for promoting betting apps
content: Prominent Tollywood actors, including Rana Daggubati and Prakash Raj, among others, face charges for promoting online betting apps, as per a complaint from a local resident. The police have intensified efforts to curb this issue, launching an online awareness campaign #SayNoToBettingApps to educate the public about the dangers of online betting.

title: 'Yuzvendra Chahal, Dhanashree are no longer husband and wife'
content: Yuzvendra Chahal's divorce from Dhanashree Verma has been finalised, with the court accepting their joint petition. The couple, who married in December 2020, had been living separately for over two years. The Bombay High Court expedited the process considering Chahal's IPL commitments. Dhanashree is notable for her dance performances. Dhanashree and Chahal got engaged in 2020 and tied the knot in December of the same year in a private ceremony in Gurugram.

title: Amazon layoffs: When CEO Andy Jassy said he wants fewer managers because ...
content: Amazon is reportedly cutting 14,000 jobs, although the company has not officially confirmed this figure. CEO Andy Jassy is pushing for a flatter company structure by reducing middle management. Despite employee backlash, Amazon is also enforcing a strict five-day return-to-office policy to strengthen company culture.

title: Oops, he does it again! Nitish loses cool, this time over mobile phones
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar demanded a ban on mobile phones in the assembly, criticizing their use by legislators during sessions. This led to a heated exchange with opposition leaders, who accused him of being anti-technology and outdated. Kumar's criticisms also extended to the previous governments led by Rabri Devi and her husband, Lalu Yadav.

title: Meerut: How wife lured lover to murder ex-merchant navy officer
content: Saurabh Rajput was murdered by his wife Muskan and her accomplice Sahil after returning from London to celebrate her birthday in Meerut. Muskan had manipulated Sahil by exploiting his grief and orchestrating the murder for months. Her parents have demanded the death penalty for her.

title: Top reasons stock markets rallied today
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Thursday. While BSE Sensex rose around 1,000 points intraday, Nifty50 crossed the 23,200 mark.

title: Ben Stiller, Paul McCartney, 400-plus stars urge US to act against Google, OpenAI
content: Over 400 Hollywood celebrities, including Ben Stiller and Paul McCartney, oppose OpenAI and Google's attempts to relax copyright laws for AI training. They assert that such changes threaten the entertainment industry, which supports millions of jobs and significant wages annually, emphasizing the broader impact on America's cultural and knowledge sectors.

title: New Zealand PM Christopher Luxon plays cricket at Mumbai’s Wankhede Stadium
content: New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon visited Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium, engaging with Kiwi cricketers Ajaz Patel, Ross Taylor, and Trent Boult. Luxon celebrated India-New Zealand cricketing ties and Patel's historic ten-wicket feat at the stadium. During his official visit, Luxon played cricket with children in Delhi, strengthening the bond between the two nations.

title: Former CSK star brutally mocks RCB - WATCH
content: The 18th edition of the Indian Premier League (IPL) starts on March 22, 2025, with defending champions Kolkata Knight Riders facing Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Former CSK player Subramaniam Badrinath recently mocked RCB on Instagram. AB de Villiers highlighted the tough challenges of winning the IPL and expressed hope that RCB, led by Virat Kohli, will claim the trophy this season.

title: Heart health matters: Join TOI's Medithon for expert insights
content: Heart diseases are becoming more prevalent due to lifestyle choices and genetic factors. Prevention through healthy habits, regular check-ups, and awareness is crucial. The Times of India will host a medithon on March 21 with top cardiologists discussing heart disease risks and prevention. Sessions will cover managing heart diseases and specific impacts on youngsters and women.

title: NPCI partners HitPay to enable UPI payments at 12,000-plus merchants in Singapore
content: UPI is set to expand globally as 12,000 merchants in Singapore will soon accept UPI payments. NIPL has partnered with HitPay to facilitate this expansion, enhancing the payment experience for Indian tourists. This follows partnerships in the UAE and Trinidad and Tobago.

title: Air India may place order for 30-40 new wide-body jets from Airbus, Boeing: Report
content: Air India is in discussions to order 30 to 40 wide-body aircraft, including Airbus A350 and Boeing 777X models, potentially exceeding 50. The move is part of their transformation under Tata Group ownership.

title: Yuzvendra Chahal-Dhanashree Verma are now officially divorced
content: Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma were granted a divorce by a Mumbai family court. The proceedings were fast-tracked due to Chahal's commitments with the Punjab Kings in IPL 2025. Dhanashree received INR 4.35 crore as alimony, refuting earlier rumours of a higher demand.

title: F1 pandit Eddie Jordan dies of cancer
content: Eddie Jordan, former owner of the Jordan Grand Prix F1 team, passed away at age 76 after battling aggressive cancer. Known for his energy and contributions to motorsports and other ventures, his death was announced with deep sorrow by his family. The Formula 1 community and fans honored his legacy and impact on the sport.

title: Shah declares ‘ruthless approach’ as forces kill 22 Naxalites in Chhattisgarh
content: Union home minister Amit Shah reaffirmed the government's zero-tolerance policy towards Naxalism after security forces killed 22 Naxalites in Chhattisgarh. The operation involved the BSF and DRG units, resulting in 18 casualties in Bijapur and 4 in Kanker. Shah emphasized a ruthless approach against the insurgents, aiming for a Naxal-free India by March 2023.

title: 'Glorifying invaders act of treason': UP CM Yogi amid Aurangzeb row
content: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath labelled endorsing invaders like Aurangzeb as treason, emphasizing respect for India's cultural heritage. His remarks follow the controversy over the Mughal emperor's tomb removal in Maharashtra, amid violent clashes in Nagpur where thirty-three police personnel were injured, and fifty arrests were made.

title: BCCI lifts saliva ban ahead of IPL 2025
content: The BCCI has decided to lift the ban on the use of saliva to shine the ball for the upcoming IPL season after consulting with team captains. This makes IPL the first major cricket event to reintroduce this practice post the COVID-19 pandemic. The decision, made independently of the ICC, has garnered support from the majority of captains.

title: MoS Nityanand Rai’s nephews engage in gunfight over 'minor dispute'; 1 dead
content: A gunfight between two nephews of Union state home minister Nityanand Rai in Bihar's Bhagalpur led to one death and one injury. The incident stemmed from a minor dispute that escalated, with both brothers shooting at each other. Statements are currently being recorded by the police.

title: Who is Badar Khan Suri? Indian researcher in US detained over supporting Palestine
content: Indian academic Badar Khan Suri, researching at Georgetown University, was detained by US immigration authorities. His focus on global conflict zones has raised concerns about political targeting and academic freedom. His arrest follows the detention of another Indian student, heightening scrutiny over international academics in the US.

title: Amazon, Flipkart warehouses raided over non-certificated products
content: BIS officials raided Amazon and Flipkart warehouses in Tiruvallur, seizing uncertified products worth lakhs under Section 17 of the BIS Act, 2016. Authorities confiscated items like insulated flasks and baby diapers, and warned that the offense carries penalties including imprisonment and substantial fines.

title: 'Football runs through my veins': Mamata Banerjee receives signed jersey by Messi
content: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee expressed her admiration for football legend Lionel Messi after receiving a jersey autographed by him. She described Messi as an artist with the ball and said the jersey represents Bengal's deep passion for football. Banerjee highlighted how this love for football unites people across Bengal.

title: Shakib Al Hasan cleared of suspect bowling action, ready to bowl again
content: Former Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan has been cleared to resume bowling after passing a reassessment of his action. The veteran all-rounder was suspended last December for an illegal action, which sidelined him from the ICC Champions Trophy. He is now eligible to bowl in ODIs and global leagues. The all-rounder had participated in last year's IPL auction and the PSL draft in January but could not find any takers.

title: Akbar Road signboard defaced in Delhi
content: Three men defaced the 'Akbar Road' signboard in Delhi, claiming retaliation for the alleged vandalism of Maharana Pratap's statue. Amit Rathore and Vijay, linked to the Hindu Rashtra Navnirman Sena, justified the act as a protest against signboards bearing names of historical figures they consider invaders. Further police details are awaited.

title: 'We are not talking about injuries, Rishabh Pant himself ... '
content: Lucknow Super Giants' mentor Zaheer Khan has promised an aggressive and fearless brand of cricket in the upcoming IPL season under new captain Rishabh Pant. Zaheer emphasised Pant's resilience and offensive tactics to lead the team with confidence and hope for a strong performance. Addressing concerns over injuries, Zaheer dismissed any negativity, pointing to Pant's resilience as a key factor in shaping the team's attitude.

title: Heightened security at Shambhu border after farm leaders' arrest; Dallewal shifted
content: Haryana security personnel fortified the Punjab border, detaining farmer leaders to stop their 'Delhi Chalo' march. The police removed protest structures and cleared roads closed for a year. The seventh round of discussions on minimum support price (MSP) laws took place in Chandigarh. Farmers faced heavy barricading upon their return to Punjab, with ongoing support from state officials.

title: Grabbing minor's breasts, breaking her pyjama string doesn't amount to rape: HC
content: The Allahabad High Court has revised charges against two accused in a case involving a minor girl, changing the charges from rape to aggravated sexual assault under the POCSO Act. The court determined the incident didn't constitute an attempt to rape but was still a severe sexual offense.

title: New research suggests dark energy is fading. Could the universe reverse course?
content: Recent research from the dark energy spectroscopic instrument (Desi) team indicates that dark energy, which drives the universe's expansion, is weakening. This significant finding challenges the previous notion of dark energy as a constant force and suggests a possible reversal in universal expansion.

title: How Kanpur journalist turned tables on digital arrest fraudster
content: A vigilant TV journalist from Kanpur turned the tables on a cyber fraudster who tried to extort money by posing as a CBI officer with fake claims. Instead, the journalist managed to get the scammer to transfer over Rs 10,000 to him, and reported the incident to the police.

title: Nagpur unrest: Fahim Khan's viral video inflamed communal passions, say cops
content: Fahim Khan, seen as the mastermind behind the Nagpur riots, was arrested in a pre-dawn raid. The son of a cycle repair shop owner, Khan is linked to the Minorities Democratic Party. His arrest follows the eruption of violence and his complaint against Bajrang Dal and Vishwa Hindu Parishad activists.

title: Delhi horror: Woman strangled, tied to stone and dumped in canal
content: A woman named Komal was kidnapped and murdered by Asif, an acquaintance. After a dispute, she was strangled, her body tied to a stone, and dumped in a canal. The body surfaced days later, leading to the registration of a murder case and Asif's subsequent arrest.

title: Parag to lead Royals in first 3 IPL matches as Samson recovers
content: Riyan Parag will lead Rajasthan Royals for the first three IPL matches while Sanju Samson recovers from finger surgery. Samson, cleared to bat but not to keep wickets, will thus be available only as an 'Impact Player' option. Parag, at 23, joins the youngest IPL captains, starting with the game against Sunrisers Hyderabad, followed by the chance to lead the team against KKR and CSK.

title: 22 Maoists gunned down, jawan killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
content: In an encounter in the forests of Bijapur district in Chhattisgarh, at least eighteen Maoists and a security personnel were killed. The security forces recovered weapons and explosives from the site. The operation against the Maoists is still underway, and the casualty count may increase.

title: 'Farmers' protest sites cleared to appease urban people ahead of Ludhiana bypoll'
content: Senior BJP leader Harjit Singh Grewal commended Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann for removing agitating farmers from key borders, praising his administrative capabilities. In contrast, other BJP leaders like Ravneet Singh Bittu and SAD members criticized Mann, accusing him of betraying farmers and acting under political pressure from Delhi, calling for the immediate release of arrested farm leaders.

title: IOC president elections: Meet the seven contenders
content: On Thursday, the election for the new president of the International Olympic Committee takes place at Costa Navarino, with seven contenders vying for the position. Key candidates include Sebastian Coe, David Lappartient, Juan Antonio Samaranch Junior, and Kirsty Coventry among others. Each candidate brings unique qualifications and visions for the future of the IOC.

title: Infosys to hire experienced tech workers across 40 skill sets
content: Infosys is hiring experienced professionals across 40+ skill sets, including cloud computing and cyber security, requiring at least two years' experience in related fields.

title: Team India gets Rs 58 cr cash reward: Here's the break-up
content: The Indian cricket team has been awarded a cash reward of Rs 58 crore by the BCCI for their triumph in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. The team maintained an unbeaten record, defeating New Zealand in the final, besides group-stage wins over Bangladesh, Pakistan and New Zealand, followed by a win over Australia in the semifinal.

title: 'Believe India is going to be lowering tariffs substantially': Trump
content: US President Donald Trump anticipates that India will likely reduce its tariffs on American goods after recognizing the imbalanced trade barriers. Trump has previously criticized India for imposing high tariffs and referred to the country as a 'tariff king' while discussing significant trade disparities.

title: Is the recent bounce in mid-cap and small-cap stocks sustainable?
content: Mid-cap and small-cap stocks have shown a resurgence, increasing up to 5% over the last three sessions due to improved global sentiment and reduced foreign investor selling.

title: 'Spreading Hamas propaganda': Indian researcher detained in US
content: An Indian researcher at Georgetown University, Badar Khan Suri, was arrested and faces deportation under accusations of promoting Hamas propaganda. Arrests of campus activists, including Mahmoud Khalil of Columbia University, are occurring amidst heightened scrutiny by US authorities on anti-Semitic activities under the Trump administration.

title: Massive 540-ft asteroid 2014 TN17 speeding towards Earth at 77,282 kmph
content: Asteroid 2014 TN17, a large space rock, is set to fly by Earth at a distance of 5 million kilometers on March 26, 2025. Despite the safe distance, its size and potential to alter its orbit remain a concern for NASA. A collision with such an asteroid could have catastrophic consequences equivalent to hundreds of nuclear explosions.

title: Soon you may get to pay lower toll charges on national highways - details here
content: Government is planning to lower toll charges with new annual and lifetime payment options, aiming to enhance efficiency and fairness. Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari highlighted the necessity of tolls for infrastructure investment and hinted at future policies, including satellite-based tolling.

title: Rising Indian talent to watch out for in IPL 2025
content: As the IPL 2025 season nears, standout young Indian talents such as Musheer Khan, Robin Minz, and Andre Siddarth are set to shine. They, along with other rising stars, aim to bring their batting prowess, all-rounder capabilities and impressive domestic performances to the forefront and make this edition a platform to fulfill their dream of playing for the country.

title: Congress stages 'Kumbhakaran' protest to wake up 'sleeping' BJP government in M.P.
content: During the protest led by Leader of Opposition Umang Singhar in front of the statue of Mahatma Gandhi in the legislature complex premises, MLAs played the flute to wake up Kumbhakaran

title: South Indian women bodybuilders flex in London-based Keerthana Kunnath’s award-winning photographs
content: The photographer, originally from Kozhikode, Kerala, has won the International Photography Exhibition Awards by the Royal Photographic Society in the Under 30s category for her photo-series, ‘Not What You Saw’

title: Ennore oil spill: NGT grants interim stay on ₹73-crore compensation imposed on CPCL
content: The compensation, which includes ₹38.24 crore for environmental damage and ₹35.43 crore for socio-economic impact, was levied by the TNPCB, which estimated that 517 tonnes of oil was spilled from the refinery

title: Watch: Salem auto driver creates ‘natural AC’ in vehicle to beat scorching summer heat
content: Subramaniam has installed a canopy made of corn stalks, hay, and a sprinkler system that showers water onto the roof

title: 50 journalists died due to Covid in Odisha: CM
content: In another reply, Mr. Majhi informed that 14 working journalists were attacked during the last five years in Odisha

title: MVA leaders meet Governor; complain about ‘bias’ of Assembly speaker, council chairman
content: The leaders in Maharashtra accuse presiding officers of “bias”, meet Governor to submit memorandum on legislative proceedings

title: 45 projects underway, 73 more identified for conservation of heritage sites in J&K: Omar Abdullah
content: Mr. Abdullah mentioned that no heritage conservation projects sanctioned by the central government are currently being executed by the Department of Culture or the Department of Tourism in Jammu and Kashmir

title: Discordant voices within Malayalam film industry over producers’ association publishing partial collection figures
content: Some filmmakers and producers point at ‘unfairness’ of putting out partial collection figures as the association has published just producers’ share from Kerala theatres after excluding overseas revenues, OTT revenues and exhibitors’ share

title: CPI-M leaders protest against forcible collection of taxes in Nellore
content: Nellore Municipal Commissioner Surya Teja has directed the staff to attach the properties of those who have long pending dues

title: Bengaluru to get relief from summer sun, IMD predicts light rain on March 22 and 23
content: Light rain and thundershowers are likely to occur at isolated places of Bengaluru Urban and neighbouring districts, accordign to the IMD.

title: No vendetta politics in land grabbing case of H.D. Kumaraswamy, says Karnataka Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar
content: Says officials following orders of High Court of Karnataka with regard to alleged encroachment of close to 18 acres by Union Minister for Heavy Industries H.D. Kumaraswamy and his family members

title: Supreme Court raps lawyer for using 'consensual relationship' in bail plea of client booked for minor's rape
content: The Bench wanted to set the fact straight with the lawyer that consent was immaterial if the survivor was a minor

title: BIS cracks down on warehouses of Amazon, Flipkart for non-certified products in T.N.
content: It was found that some products were stored and sold without the ISI mark, though they were covered under the BIS mandatory certification

title: Twenty two Maoists killed in twin Bastar encounters
content: 22 Maoists and a security personnel killed in anti-Maoist operations in Chhattisgarh, with ongoing exchange of fire

title: A.P. government revived 74 Centrally Sponsored Schemes by paying its share of nearly ₹12,337 crore, says Finance Minister  Keshav
content: The non-payment of the State’s share of the schemes by the previous government resulted in Centre imposing penalties amounting to about ₹350 crore

title: Meerut murder: ‘Killer’ wife spends first night in prison; shuns jail food
content: Police have claimed that the duo planned and killed Saurabh because they considered him to be an obstacle in their relationship

title: T.N. saw 1,540 murders in 2024, lowest in 12 years: CM Stalin in Assembly
content: When comapring the number of murders between 2012 and 2024, the highest figure of 1,943 murders was recorded in 2012, when the AIADMK was in power, Mr. Stalin said

title: UK Parliament award enhanced my brother’s glory: Pawan Kalyan
content: Mr. Chiranjeevi, son of an ordinary middle-class excise constable, rose to become a Megastar in the film industry through his own efforts, the Deputy Chief Minister said

title: Taxi driver arrested for sexual assault of two minors in Kerala
content: Accused was allegedly in a live-in relationship with mother of the two sisters aged 10 and 12 years old

title: Except Bengaluru, all urban local bodies in Karnataka received less than 1% of budget allocation: Tumakuru MLA
content: BJP MLA G. B. Jyothi Ganesh said all development works have come to a halt in cities and towns owing to denial of funds to ULBs

title: ASI erects tin sheets around Aurangzeb's tomb amid calls to raze it
content: Tin sheets and wire fencing were put up on two sides of the structure and a circular fence will also be installed around the tomb in Maharashtra's Sambhajinagar

title: Liquid Robotics and Sagar Defence Engineering Sign MoU for autonomous surface vessels
content: This is the first such project by an Indian startup with a U.S. company, the companies said in a statement

title: Bengaluru Metro considers cargo transport to boost non-fare revenue
content: BMRCL plans to engage with logistics and e-commerce companies to discuss the feasibility of this initiative, taking inspiration from Delhi Metro.

title: Taiwan can help India reduce trade deficit with China: Taiwanese Deputy NSA
content: Mr. Hsu said a trade deal will pave the way for greater investment in India by Taiwanese companies in the semiconductor and other high-technology sectors as it will help to bring down the "high tariff" regime

title: Rachakonda police bust inter-State child trafficking racket; 10 infants rescued, 18 adoptive parents arrested
content: The arrested gang include an ASHA worker from Malakpet, a mediator from Nagpur, a lab technician at Gandhi Hospital, the owner of a marriage bureau in Ghansi Bazar, Hyderabad, and a businessman from Abdullapurmet

title: Man accused in series of break-ins shot after attack on constable near Chidambaram
content: When a team took the accused to Sithalapadi to recover the lethal weapons used in these incidents on Thursday, he allegedly attacked Grade I constable Gnanapragasam with a sharp weapon, the police said

title: Kerala ASHA workers step up protest, begin indefinite hunger strike in front of Secretariat
content: ASHAs, under the banner of Kerala ASHA Health Workers’ Association, resorted to hunger strike after two rounds of talks with National Health Mission authorities and State Health Minister failed

title: Kerala Assembly: UDF walks out over anganwadi workers’ pay dispute
content: Speaker denies permission to move adjournment motion to discuss demands of protesting anganwadi workers, including hike in pay to ₹21,000

title: Andhra Pradesh government appoints four Advisors with Cabinet rank
content: Sreedhara Panicker Somnath, G. Satheesh Reddy, Suchitra Ella and K.P.C. Gandhi were appointed as honorary advisors in space technology, aerospace & defence manufacturing hub, handlooms & handicrafts development and forensic science sectors respectively

title: Himachal Pradesh High Court directs BFI to allow Thakur's nomination in its polls
content: Justice Ajay Mohan Goel on March 20 ruled that the Electoral College approved by Returning Officer R.K. Gauba on March 13, which left out Mr. Thakur, ‘is prima facie bad and not sustainable in law’

title: Andhra Pradesh Assembly Speaker Ayyanna questions absenteeism of YSRCP MLAs during Budget session
content: ‘They (YSRCP MLAs) have defeated the purpose of being sent to the Assembly by the people of their constituencies,’ says  Speaker Ch. Ayyanna Patrudu

title: Fishermen block Anchuthengu-Perumathura coastal road demanding desilting of Muthalapozhy harbour mouth
content: Kerala government and Adani Port are locked in a dispute over who should desilt Muthalapozhy harbour mouth

title: Northeast records first dog-faced snake
content: Herpetologists are intrigued by the presence of the mildly venomous semi-aquatic snake far from the coastal ecosystem where it thrives

title: Opposition decries takeover of Kashmir Press Club building, offices by police in Srinagar
content: Srinagar is without a press club since the J&K administration in January 2022 put in abeyance the registration of the Kashmir Press Club (KPC), at a time when it was preparing elections.

title: Nitish Kumar loses his cool over the use of mobile phones in the Bihar Assembly
content: Nitish Kumar lost his cool over Rashtriya Janata Dal MLA from Jehanabad Suday Yadav reading his question from his mobile phone; Phones are used to ensure the House is paperless, says Tejashwi Yadav

title: T.N. Assembly: BJP MLA Vanathi alleges lack of long-term strategies in Budget; Minister Thennarasu blames Centre for not releasing funds
content: Mr. Thennarasu said the Centre had withheld funds due to the State under Samagra Shiksha and wages for workers under the MGNREGS

title: Director of Himachal power corporation suspended after protests over chief engineer's death
content: The wife of deceased engineer Vimal Negi has claimed that his death was “not a suicide but murder”, alleging that her husband was pressurised, denied holidays and harassed even when he was unwell

title: Stay back and listen to me if you have the guts, CM Stalin tells Palaniswami in T.N. Assembly
content: “I am not saying that these incidents did not take place. The point is whether the government has taken action or not,” the Chief Minister told Mr. Palaniswami, who staged a walkout with AIADMK MLAs.

title: Pakistani intruder apprehended along International Border in  Jammu and Kashmir’s Kathua
content: The intruder, apprehended by security forces along International Border in Kathua district of Jammu and Kashmir, has been identified as Qadir Baksh, a resident of Gafurabad, Tehsil Chiniot, Pakistan

title: Arunachal Pradesh Dy CM unveils memorial for Adi warriors who resisted British occupation in 1894
content: Deputy Chief Minister Chowna Mein said the Miren Batum Lingkang War Memorial was a tribute to the unsung heroes of India’s freedom movement

title: P. Appukuttan, dramatist and former Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Akademi secretary, passes away at 85
content: Appukuttan, who served as Akademi’s secretary from 1996 to 2001, was a prominent figure in Purogamana Kala Sahitya Sangham

title: Madras High Court seeks ED’s response to writ petitions filed by TASMAC against search operation
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and N. Senthilkumar grant time till Monday to the central agency to file its counter affidavits to two writ petitions

title: Who Is Badar Khan Suri, the Indian researcher facing deportation from the U.S.?
content: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has accused Indian researcher Badar Khan Suri of having ties to the Palestinian militant group Hamas and spreading Hamas propaganda and antisemitic content on social media

title: Nagpur violence: Police form 18 special teams to nab culprits
content: As of now, 69 persons have been in connection with the violence; Curfew remained imposed in several areas of the city for the third day on March 20

title: After Punjab, Haryana police remove barricades to clear Shambhu-Ambala road; farmers announce dharnas
content: Samyukta Kisan Morcha (Non-Political) and the Kisan Mazdoor Morcha on Thursday (March 20, 2025) announced to hold dharnas outside the offices of deputy commissioners in protest against the Punjab Police crackdown

title: Two Maoists, cop killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur
content: The gunfight started in a forest along the border of Bijapur and Dantewada districts when a joint team of security personnel was out on an anti-Maoists operation in Gangaloor police station area

title: BJP cancels ‘Bihar Diwas’ celebration plan in Assam
content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said antipathy and narrow-mindedness would affect the climate of investment in the State

title: Two suspected irregular migrants from Bangladesh arrested at Angamaly in Kerala
content: FIR says the two were working as masons. Reportedly, they crossed the border to West Bengal in 2017 where they secured fake Aadhaar cards with assistance of agents and later travelled to Kerala

title: Situation in Manipur's Churachandpur district still tense; schools, shops remain shut
content: “Schools and shops remained shut, while church leaders and civil society groups worked to restore peace,” an official said

title: Patients hit as post-operative specimen biopsy unit at State-run Kidwai cancer hospital in Bengaluru stops functioning
content: The only histopathology machine in the hospital is out of order. Histopathology services are essential for the diagnosis, staging, and treatment planning of cancer patients

title: Rajasthan govt tables Bill to regulate coaching centres amid student suicides
content: As many as 28 students died by suicide in Kota in 2023, while 17 died in 2024. At least seven coaching students have committed suicide so far this year

title: T.N. Governor, CM greet Sunita Williams on her safe return
content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin also welcomed the safe return of Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who were struck in the International Space Station for 287 days.

title: Farmers protest LIVE: Punjab witnesses statewide protests against detention of farmers
content: Samyukta Kisan Morcha (Non-Political) and the Kisan Mazdoor Morcha on March 20 announced to hold dharnas outside the offices of deputy commissioners in protest against the Punjab Police crackdown on Shambhu border

title: West Bengal to allow women to work in bars, Bill passed in Assembly
content: It seeks to amend the Bengal Excise Act, 1909, “to remove the prohibition on employment of women in ON category liquor shops as such provision is discriminatory”

title: IndiaAI Mission, Gates Foundation to sign MoU on AI in agriculture, healthcare: Vaishnaw
content: IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said that the Gates Foundation would tie up with the Centre’s IndiaAI Mission to develop AI solutions for agriculture, education, healthcare, and climate resilience

title: Fire at market in Maharashtra’s Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar; 20 shops damaged
content: The blaze erupted at around 5 am in the market at Central Naka in Azad Chowk area in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar, where several furniture shops are located.

title: Behind the Scene, a one-of-its-kind app to streamline film production, launched in Malayalam cinema
content: The app, developed by Shameer Sharafudeen and Renjith Raghunathan from Thiruvananthapuram, is currently being used in several  Malayalam movies

title: Indian student at Georgetown University detained over Hamas links amid Trump’s crackdown on pro-Palestinian protests
content: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security accused Badar Khan Suri of ties to the Palestinian militant group Hamas and said he had spread Hamas propaganda and antisemitism on social media

title: Uber Shuttle’s Hyderabad rollout runs into permit trouble; 40 bus owners penalised, 11 buses seized
content: ‘Some of these buses had permits for wedding parties or sightseeing, but none had valid permissions for stage-carriage operations’

title: Bengali litterateurs protest ‘omission’ of Bengali from Sahitya Akademi Award this year
content: Writers and scholars from West Bengal have raised questions on why Bengali literary works and writers were excluded from the 2024 Sahitya Akademi Award despite Bengali being deemed a ‘classical language’ by the Government of India last year

title: Dignity above gold: Revisiting the KGF workers’ strike of 1930
content: Historian Janaki Nair, in her recent talk on a workers’ struggle in KGF in 1930, says that it was more about dignity and self-worth than wages or working conditions

title: What are the different risks and rewards of using UAVs? | Explained
content: Why are Unmanned Aerial Vehicles seen as less of a threat compared to inhabited or piloted fighter jets? How should India evolve as UAVs become integrated into military operations?

title: Is the APAAR ID for students mandatory? | Explained
content: What does APAAR stand for? What are its touted benefits? Are State governments and school authorities pushing for its large-scale adoption? Is the collection of personal data of minors without a backing law constitutional? What are digital activists saying?

title: Meerut murder: Wife, her lover sent to 14-day judicial custody, lawyers attack them after hearing
content: Some lawyers grabbed the man’s clothes in the melee as police tried to form a ring around the duo to protect them. Police officers had to jostle with the lawyers while they took the accused to safety

title: West Bengal DGP’s wife named State information commissioner
content: Activists question Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari’s absence from meetings to appoint members to quasi judicial bodies, stating that it helps the State appoint candidates of its choice

title: BJP trying to ‘erase Shivaji’ through its pursuit of Aurangzeb: Shiv Sena (UBT)
content: The Shiv Sena (UBT) slammed the BJP for using Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and Chhatrapati Sambhaji Raje whenever convenient

title: Central projects will strengthen port modernisation and hinterland tourism in Goa: CM
content: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant attended and addressed the National Sagarmala Apex Committee Meeting, chaired by Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal in the presence of his cabinet colleague Nitin Gadkari in New Delhi.

title: Nagpur violence: No cloth with Quranic verses burnt; rioters will be`dug out from graves', says CM Fadnavis
content: Whatever happened two days ago was a planned incident by a few people. I am not blaming any community....we did not find any 'Ayat' (Quranic verse) on the cloth that was burnt, says Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis

title: India and the U.S. should expand TRUST to climate risk: Niti Aayog Vice-Chairman
content: Climate finance is crucial in supporting adaptation initiatives, says Union Minister Kirti Vardhan Singh at a conference co-organised by the Union Environment Ministry and Harvard University

title: Inside MLB's process of authenticating game-used items
content: pitcher Roki Sasaki wears an MLB debut patch on the left sleeve of his jersey . the patch will be embedded into his one-of-one numbered Topps Chrome Update Rookie Debut Patch Autograph Card . it's important for collectors to covet, chase and ultimately pull items that come off the field .

title: MLB's spoilers: Six teams that can drop the mighty Dodgers this season
content: six of our experts pick one team they think is best suited to take down the Dodgers in October . they made their best cases for their club having the right formula to knock L.A. out . the case for the D-backs has already done this .

title: Predicting 10 women's early-round upsets
content: the 2023 women's NCAA tournament produced four upsets . there were five in 2022, the second round gave us one last year and two the year before that . a no. 10 over a No. 7 counts just like a . no. 6 beating a. 3 in the first round .

title: Why betting the NCAA tournament is completely different from filling out your bracket
content: more people than ever are placing bets in addition to filling out their brackets . filling a bracket is like playing with pawns in chess, while sports betting is like controlling the queen . when you place a sports bet, you're betting on numbers, not teams .

title: Dickie V makes his March Madness picks for every game
content: the big dance is here, and I'm ready to break it down, Dickie V style! we've got PTPers (prime time performers), diaper dandies and championship-caliber coaching ready to take the court .

title: Is JuJu Watkins the best player in the women’s NCAA tournament? We rank the top 25
content: it's a time for stars to win the ultimate NCAA tournament . a chance to win their first national championship . the WNBA is a year for stars who don't win the NCAA title . it is the first time a player has won a national championship since march .

title: White Sox's 'Celebration Cake Shake' leads new MLB park confections
content: baseball teams are becoming more innovative and stepping up their food game in 2025 . the "Celebration Cake Shake" features birthday cake ice cream, confetti cake, a pinwheel cookie and a maraschino cherry . this follows the White Sox's "Campfire Milkshake" from last season .

title: USMNT wild cards who can fill vets' boots in Nations League
content: Josh Sargent reveals how his mentality has helped him find the net for Norwich . Mauricio Pochettino has sustained some body blows in the past 48 hours . the same is true for getting on the field, and the opportunity is there for some players to get unexpected .

title: Let the fun begin: Make your picks for the women's tournament
content: Welcome back to the #1 Women's Bracket game! The tourney tips off Friday, 3/21 @ 11:30a ET - don't get locked out, create your brackets today! Be sure to create a group and invite your friends to share in the madness.

title: It's bracket time: Make your picks for the men's tournament
content: Welcome back to the #1 men's bracket game! The tourney tips off Thursday, 3/20 @ 12:15p ET - don't get locked out, create your brackets today! Don't forget to create a group and invite your friends to share in the madness.
